page.title: 16Malton Picnic Site
page.content: Malton Picnic Site is to the West of Lanchester.It has been open since Easter 1984 and it is a popular venue especially for families .It is owned by Durham County Council . The River Browney and the disused Durham to Consett railway line are main features of the site.Brown trout swim in the river and along the railway line many wild flowers grow.There are all kinds of wild life including many species of birds and red squirrels. The eight acre site is visited by many people each weekend.Two part-time workers are employed to look after it. Many children visit the site.Many enjoy sailing or swimming and sometimes there are dingys at Malton. There are life belts there so it is quite safe.
